aadAudience.description: AAD Vpn authentication parameter AAD audience.

aadIssuer.description: AAD Vpn authentication parameter AAD issuer.

aadTenant.description: AAD Vpn authentication parameter AAD tenant.

addressPrefixes.description: A list of address blocks reserved for this virtual network in CIDR notation.

name.description: Name of the authentication certificate that is unique within an Application Gateway.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway authentication certificate.

maxCapacity.description: Upper bound on number of Application Gateway capacity.

minCapacity.description: Lower bound on number of Application Gateway capacity.

name.description: Name of the backend http settings that is unique within an Application Gateway.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway backend HTTP settings.

affinityCookieName.description: Cookie name to use for the affinity cookie.

authenticationCertificates.description: Array of references to application gateway authentication certificates.

connectionDraining.description: Connection draining of the backend http settings resource.

hostName.description: Host header to be sent to the backend servers.

path.description: Path which should be used as a prefix for all HTTP requests. Null means no path will be prefixed. Default value is null.

pickHostNameFromBackendAddress.description: Whether to pick host header should be picked from the host name of the backend server. Default value is false.

port.description: The destination port on the backend.

probe.description: Probe resource of an application gateway.

probeEnabled.description: Whether the probe is enabled. Default value is false.

protocol.description: The protocol used to communicate with the backend.

requestTimeout.description: Request timeout in seconds. Application Gateway will fail the request if response is not received within RequestTimeout. Acceptable values are from 1 second to 86400 seconds.

trustedRootCertificates.description: Array of references to application gateway trusted root certificates.

verifyClientCertIssuerDN.description: Verify client certificate issuer name on the application gateway.

drainTimeoutInSec.description: The number of seconds connection draining is active. Acceptable values are from 1 second to 3600 seconds.

enabled.description: Whether connection draining is enabled or not.

customErrorPageUrl.description: Error page URL of the application gateway customer error.

statusCode.description: Status code of the application gateway customer error.

ruleGroupName.description: The name of the rule group that will be disabled.

rules.description: The list of rules that will be disabled. If null, all rules of the rule group will be disabled.

selector.description: When matchVariable is a collection, operator used to specify which elements in the collection this exclusion applies to.

selectorMatchOperator.description: When matchVariable is a collection, operate on the selector to specify which elements in the collection this exclusion applies to.

name.description: Name of the frontend IP configuration that is unique within an Application Gateway.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway frontend IP configuration.

privateIPAddress.description: PrivateIPAddress of the network interface IP Configuration.

privateIPAllocationMethod.description: The private IP address allocation method.

privateLinkConfiguration.description: Reference to the application gateway private link configuration.

name.description: Name of the frontend port that is unique within an Application Gateway.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway frontend port.

headerName.description: Header name of the header configuration.

headerValue.description: Header value of the header configuration.

name.description: Name of the HTTP listener that is unique within an Application Gateway.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway HTTP listener.

customErrorConfigurations.description: Custom error configurations of the HTTP listener.

frontendIPConfiguration.description: Frontend IP configuration resource of an application gateway.

frontendPort.description: Frontend port resource of an application gateway.

hostNames.description: List of Host names for HTTP Listener that allows special wildcard characters as well.

requireServerNameIndication.description: Applicable only if protocol is https. Enables SNI for multi-hosting.

sslCertificate.description: SSL certificate resource of an application gateway.

sslProfile.description: SSL profile resource of the application gateway.

name.description: Name of the IP configuration that is unique within an Application Gateway.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway IP configuration.

subnet.description: Reference to the subnet resource. A subnet from where application gateway gets its private address.

name.description: Name of the path rule that is unique within an Application Gateway.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway path rule.

backendAddressPool.description: Backend address pool resource of URL path map path rule.

backendHttpSettings.description: Backend http settings resource of URL path map path rule.

paths.description: Path rules of URL path map.

redirectConfiguration.description: Redirect configuration resource of URL path map path rule.

rewriteRuleSet.description: Rewrite rule set resource of URL path map path rule.

privateLinkServiceConnectionState.description: A collection of information about the state of the connection between service consumer and provider.

name.description: Name of the private link configuration that is unique within an Application Gateway.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway private link configuration.

ipConfigurations.description: An array of application gateway private link ip configurations.

name.description: The name of application gateway private link ip configuration.

properties.description: Properties of an application gateway private link ip configuration.

primary.description: Whether the ip configuration is primary or not.

privateIPAddress.description: The private IP address of the IP configuration.

privateIPAllocationMethod.description: The private IP address allocation method.

name.description: Name of the probe that is unique within an Application Gateway.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway probe.

body.description: Body that must be contained in the health response. Default value is empty.

statusCodes.description: Allowed ranges of healthy status codes. Default range of healthy status codes is 200-399.

host.description: Host name to send the probe to.

interval.description: The probing interval in seconds. This is the time interval between two consecutive probes. Acceptable values are from 1 second to 86400 seconds.

match.description: Criterion for classifying a healthy probe response.

minServers.description: Minimum number of servers that are always marked healthy. Default value is 0.

path.description: Relative path of probe. Valid path starts from '/'. Probe is sent to <Protocol>://<host>:<port><path>.

pickHostNameFromBackendHttpSettings.description: Whether the host header should be picked from the backend http settings. Default value is false.

port.description: Custom port which will be used for probing the backend servers. The valid value ranges from 1 to 65535. In case not set, port from http settings will be used. This property is valid for Standard_v2 and WAF_v2 only.

protocol.description: The protocol used for the probe.

timeout.description: The probe timeout in seconds. Probe marked as failed if valid response is not received with this timeout period. Acceptable values are from 1 second to 86400 seconds.

unhealthyThreshold.description: The probe retry count. Backend server is marked down after consecutive probe failure count reaches UnhealthyThreshold. Acceptable values are from 1 second to 20.

authenticationCertificates.description: Authentication certificates of the application gateway resource. For default limits, see [Application Gateway limits](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-subscription-service-limits#application-gateway-limits).

backendAddressPools.description: Backend address pool of the application gateway resource. For default limits, see [Application Gateway limits](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-subscription-service-limits#application-gateway-limits).

backendHttpSettingsCollection.description: Backend http settings of the application gateway resource. For default limits, see [Application Gateway limits](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-subscription-service-limits#application-gateway-limits).

customErrorConfigurations.description: Custom error configurations of the application gateway resource.

enableFips.description: Whether FIPS is enabled on the application gateway resource.

enableHttp2.description: Whether HTTP2 is enabled on the application gateway resource.

forceFirewallPolicyAssociation.description: If true, associates a firewall policy with an application gateway regardless whether the policy differs from the WAF Config.

frontendIPConfigurations.description: Frontend IP addresses of the application gateway resource. For default limits, see [Application Gateway limits](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-subscription-service-limits#application-gateway-limits).

frontendPorts.description: Frontend ports of the application gateway resource. For default limits, see [Application Gateway limits](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-subscription-service-limits#application-gateway-limits).

gatewayIPConfigurations.description: Subnets of the application gateway resource. For default limits, see [Application Gateway limits](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-subscription-service-limits#application-gateway-limits).

httpListeners.description: Http listeners of the application gateway resource. For default limits, see [Application Gateway limits](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-subscription-service-limits#application-gateway-limits).

probes.description: Probes of the application gateway resource.

redirectConfigurations.description: Redirect configurations of the application gateway resource. For default limits, see [Application Gateway limits](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-subscription-service-limits#application-gateway-limits).

requestRoutingRules.description: Request routing rules of the application gateway resource.

rewriteRuleSets.description: Rewrite rules for the application gateway resource.

sku.description: SKU of the application gateway resource.

sslCertificates.description: SSL certificates of the application gateway resource. For default limits, see [Application Gateway limits](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-subscription-service-limits#application-gateway-limits).

sslPolicy.description: SSL policy of the application gateway resource.

sslProfiles.description: SSL profiles of the application gateway resource. For default limits, see [Application Gateway limits](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-subscription-service-limits#application-gateway-limits).

trustedClientCertificates.description: Trusted client certificates of the application gateway resource. For default limits, see [Application Gateway limits](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-subscription-service-limits#application-gateway-limits).

trustedRootCertificates.description: Trusted Root certificates of the application gateway resource. For default limits, see [Application Gateway limits](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-subscription-service-limits#application-gateway-limits).

urlPathMaps.description: URL path map of the application gateway resource. For default limits, see [Application Gateway limits](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-subscription-service-limits#application-gateway-limits).

name.description: Name of the redirect configuration that is unique within an Application Gateway.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway redirect configuration.

includePath.description: Include path in the redirected url.

includeQueryString.description: Include query string in the redirected url.

targetListener.description: Reference to a listener to redirect the request to.

targetUrl.description: Url to redirect the request to.

urlPathMaps.description: Url path maps specifying default redirect configuration.

name.description: Name of the request routing rule that is unique within an Application Gateway.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway request routing rule.

backendAddressPool.description: Backend address pool resource of the application gateway.

backendHttpSettings.description: Backend http settings resource of the application gateway.

httpListener.description: Http listener resource of the application gateway.

priority.description: Priority of the request routing rule.

redirectConfiguration.description: Redirect configuration resource of the application gateway.

rewriteRuleSet.description: Rewrite Rule Set resource in Basic rule of the application gateway.

urlPathMap.description: URL path map resource of the application gateway.

actionSet.description: Set of actions to be done as part of the rewrite Rule.

conditions.description: Conditions based on which the action set execution will be evaluated.

name.description: Name of the rewrite rule that is unique within an Application Gateway.

ruleSequence.description: Rule Sequence of the rewrite rule that determines the order of execution of a particular rule in a RewriteRuleSet.

requestHeaderConfigurations.description: Request Header Actions in the Action Set.

responseHeaderConfigurations.description: Response Header Actions in the Action Set.

urlConfiguration.description: Url Configuration Action in the Action Set.

ignoreCase.description: Setting this parameter to truth value with force the pattern to do a case in-sensitive comparison.

negate.description: Setting this value as truth will force to check the negation of the condition given by the user.

pattern.description: The pattern, either fixed string or regular expression, that evaluates the truthfulness of the condition.

variable.description: The condition parameter of the RewriteRuleCondition.

name.description: Name of the rewrite rule set that is unique within an Application Gateway.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway rewrite rule set.

rewriteRules.description: Rewrite rules in the rewrite rule set.

capacity.description: Capacity (instance count) of an application gateway.

name.description: Name of an application gateway SKU.
Name of the SSL certificate that is unique within an Application Gateway.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway SSL certificate.

data.description: Base-64 encoded pfx certificate. Only applicable in PUT Request.

keyVaultSecretId.description: Secret Id of (base-64 encoded unencrypted pfx) 'Secret' or 'Certificate' object stored in KeyVault.

password.description: Password for the pfx file specified in data. Only applicable in PUT request.

cipherSuites.description: Ssl cipher suites to be enabled in the specified order to application gateway.

disabledSslProtocols.description: Ssl protocols to be disabled on application gateway.

minProtocolVersion.description: Minimum version of Ssl protocol to be supported on application gateway.

name.description: Name of the SSL profile that is unique within an Application Gateway.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway SSL profile.

clientAuthConfiguration.description: Client authentication configuration of the application gateway resource.

name.description: Name of the trusted root certificate that is unique within an Application Gateway.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway trusted root certificate.

keyVaultSecretId.description: Secret Id of (base-64 encoded unencrypted pfx) 'Secret' or 'Certificate' object stored in KeyVault.

modifiedPath.description: Url path which user has provided for url rewrite. Null means no path will be updated. Default value is null.

modifiedQueryString.description: Query string which user has provided for url rewrite. Null means no query string will be updated. Default value is null.

reroute.description: If set as true, it will re-evaluate the url path map provided in path based request routing rules using modified path. Default value is false.

name.description: Name of the URL path map that is unique within an Application Gateway.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway URL path map.

pathRules.description: Path rule of URL path map resource.

fileUploadLimitInMb.description: Maximum file upload size in Mb for WAF.

maxRequestBodySize.description: Maximum request body size for WAF.

maxRequestBodySizeInKb.description: Maximum request body size in Kb for WAF.

requestBodyCheck.description: Whether allow WAF to check request Body.

ruleSetType.description: The type of the web application firewall rule set. Possible values are: 'OWASP'.

ruleSetVersion.description: The version of the rule set type.

destinationAddresses.description: List of destination IP addresses or Service Tags.

fqdnTags.description: List of FQDN Tags for this rule.

sourceAddresses.description: List of source IP addresses for this rule.

sourceIpGroups.description: List of source IpGroups for this rule.

targetFqdns.description: List of FQDNs for this rule.

targetUrls.description: List of Urls for this rule condition.

terminateTLS.description: Terminate TLS connections for this rule.

webCategories.description: List of destination azure web categories.

sourceAddresses.description: List of source IP addresses for this rule.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within the Azure firewall. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the azure firewall application rule collection.

action.description: The action type of a rule collection.

priority.description: Priority of the application rule collection resource.

rules.description: Collection of rules used by a application rule collection.

port.description: Port number for the protocol, cannot be greater than 64000. This field is optional.

name.description: Name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the azure firewall IP configuration.

publicIPAddress.description: Reference to the PublicIP resource. This field is a mandatory input if subnet is not null.

subnet.description: Reference to the subnet resource. This resource must be named 'AzureFirewallSubnet' or 'AzureFirewallManagementSubnet'.

destinationAddresses.description: List of destination IP addresses for this rule. Supports IP ranges, prefixes, and service tags.

protocols.description: Array of AzureFirewallNetworkRuleProtocols applicable to this NAT rule.

sourceAddresses.description: List of source IP addresses for this rule.

sourceIpGroups.description: List of source IpGroups for this rule.

translatedAddress.description: The translated address for this NAT rule.

translatedFqdn.description: The translated FQDN for this NAT rule.

translatedPort.description: The translated port for this NAT rule.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within the Azure firewall. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the azure firewall NAT rule collection.

action.description: The action type of a NAT rule collection.

priority.description: Priority of the NAT rule collection resource.

rules.description: Collection of rules used by a NAT rule collection.

destinationIpGroups.description: List of destination IpGroups for this rule.

sourceAddresses.description: List of source IP addresses for this rule.

sourceIpGroups.description: List of source IpGroups for this rule.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within the Azure firewall. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the azure firewall network rule collection.

action.description: The action type of a rule collection.

priority.description: Priority of the network rule collection resource.

rules.description: Collection of rules used by a network rule collection.

additionalProperties.description: The additional properties used to further config this azure firewall.

applicationRuleCollections.description: Collection of application rule collections used by Azure Firewall.

firewallPolicy.description: The firewallPolicy associated with this azure firewall.

ipConfigurations.description: IP configuration of the Azure Firewall resource.

managementIpConfiguration.description: IP configuration of the Azure Firewall used for management traffic.

natRuleCollections.description: Collection of NAT rule collections used by Azure Firewall.

networkRuleCollections.description: Collection of network rule collections used by Azure Firewall.

threatIntelMode.description: The operation mode for Threat Intelligence.

virtualHub.description: The virtualHub to which the firewall belongs.

name.description: Name of an Azure Firewall SKU.
Name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Represents the ip configuration associated with the resource.

dnsName.description: FQDN for the endpoint on which bastion host is accessible.

ipConfigurations.description: IP configuration of the Bastion Host resource.

bgpPeeringAddress.description: The BGP peering address and BGP identifier of this BGP speaker.

bgpPeeringAddresses.description: BGP peering address with IP configuration ID for virtual network gateway.

peerWeight.description: The weight added to routes learned from this BGP speaker.

allow.description: Flag to control breakout of o365 allow category.

default.description: Flag to control breakout of o365 default category.

optimize.description: Flag to control breakout of o365 optimize category.

address.description: Address of the connection monitor destination (IP or domain name).

port.description: The destination port used by connection monitor.

resourceId.description: The ID of the resource used as the destination by connection monitor.

address.description: Address of the connection monitor endpoint (IP or domain name).

filter.description: Filter for sub-items within the endpoint.

name.description: The name of the connection monitor endpoint.

resourceId.description: Resource ID of the connection monitor endpoint.

items.description: List of items in the filter.

type.description: The behavior of the endpoint filter. Currently only 'Include' is supported.

address.description: The address of the filter item.

type.description: The type of item included in the filter. Currently only 'AgentAddress' is supported.

exclude.description: List of items which needs to be excluded from the endpoint scope.

include.description: List of items which needs to be included to the endpoint scope.

address.description: The address of the endpoint item. Supported types are IPv4/IPv6 subnet mask or IPv4/IPv6 IP address.

path.description: The path component of the URI. For instance, "/dir1/dir2".

preferHTTPS.description: Value indicating whether HTTPS is preferred over HTTP in cases where the choice is not explicit.

requestHeaders.description: The HTTP headers to transmit with the request.

validStatusCodeRanges.description: HTTP status codes to consider successful. For instance, "2xx,301-304,418".

disableTraceRoute.description: Value indicating whether path evaluation with trace route should be disabled.

type.description: Connection monitor output destination type. Currently, only "Workspace" is supported.

workspaceSettings.description: Describes the settings for producing output into a log analytics workspace.

autoStart.description: Determines if the connection monitor will start automatically once created.

destination.description: Describes the destination of connection monitor.

notes.description: Optional notes to be associated with the connection monitor.

source.description: Describes the source of connection monitor.

testConfigurations.description: List of connection monitor test configurations.

testGroups.description: List of connection monitor test groups.

port.description: The source port used by connection monitor.

resourceId.description: The ID of the resource used as the source by connection monitor.

checksFailedPercent.description: The maximum percentage of failed checks permitted for a test to evaluate as successful.

roundTripTimeMs.description: The maximum round-trip time in milliseconds permitted for a test to evaluate as successful.

disableTraceRoute.description: Value indicating whether path evaluation with trace route should be disabled.

httpConfiguration.description: The parameters used to perform test evaluation over HTTP.

icmpConfiguration.description: The parameters used to perform test evaluation over ICMP.

name.description: The name of the connection monitor test configuration.

preferredIPVersion.description: The preferred IP version to use in test evaluation. The connection monitor may choose to use a different version depending on other parameters.

protocol.description: The protocol to use in test evaluation.

successThreshold.description: The threshold for declaring a test successful.

tcpConfiguration.description: The parameters used to perform test evaluation over TCP.

testFrequencySec.description: The frequency of test evaluation, in seconds.

disable.description: Value indicating whether test group is disabled.

name.description: The name of the connection monitor test group.

properties.description: Container network interface configuration properties.

containerNetworkInterfaces.description: A list of container network interfaces created from this container network interface configuration.

ipConfigurations.description: A list of ip configurations of the container network interface configuration.

fqdn.description: Fqdn that resolves to private endpoint ip address.

ipAddresses.description: A list of private ip addresses of the private endpoint.

protocolCustomSettings.description: The protocol-specific DDoS policy customization parameters.

ddosCustomPolicy.description: The DDoS custom policy associated with the public IP.

protectedIP.description: Enables DDoS protection on the public IP.

protectionCoverage.description: The DDoS protection policy customizability of the public IP. Only standard coverage will have the ability to be customized.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within a subnet. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the subnet.

dnsServers.description: The list of DNS servers IP addresses.

enableProxy.description: Enable DNS Proxy on Firewalls attached to the Firewall Policy.

requireProxyForNetworkRules.description: FQDNs in Network Rules are supported when set to true.

markings.description: List of markings to be used in the configuration.

addressPrefix.description: /29 IP address space to carve out Customer addresses for tunnels.

expressRouteCircuitPeering.description: Reference to Express Route Circuit Private Peering Resource of the circuit initiating connection.

ipv6CircuitConnectionConfig.description: IPv6 Address PrefixProperties of the express route circuit connection.

peerExpressRouteCircuitPeering.description: Reference to Express Route Circuit Private Peering Resource of the peered circuit.

advertisedCommunities.description: The communities of bgp peering. Specified for microsoft peering.

legacyMode.description: The legacy mode of the peering.

id.description: The ID of the ExpressRoute circuit peering.

connections.description: The list of circuit connections associated with Azure Private Peering for this circuit.

routeFilter.description: The reference to the RouteFilter resource.

stats.description: The peering stats of express route circuit.

bandwidthInGbps.description: The bandwidth of the circuit when the circuit is provisioned on an ExpressRoutePort resource.

circuitProvisioningState.description: The CircuitProvisioningState state of the resource.

expressRoutePort.description: The reference to the ExpressRoutePort resource when the circuit is provisioned on an ExpressRoutePort resource.

serviceProviderProvisioningState.description: The ServiceProviderProvisioningState state of the resource.

primarybytesIn.description: The Primary BytesIn of the peering.

primarybytesOut.description: The primary BytesOut of the peering.

secondarybytesIn.description: The secondary BytesIn of the peering.

secondarybytesOut.description: The secondary BytesOut of the peering.

authorizationKey.description: Authorization key to establish the connection.

routingConfiguration.description: The Routing Configuration indicating the associated and propagated route tables on this connection.

routingWeight.description: The routing weight associated to the connection.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the express route cross connection peering.

serviceProviderNotes.description: Additional read only notes set by the connectivity provider.

serviceProviderProvisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the circuit in the connectivity provider system.

virtualHub.description: The Virtual Hub where the ExpressRoute gateway is or will be deployed.

bounds.description: Minimum and maximum number of scale units to deploy.

max.description: Maximum number of scale units deployed for ExpressRoute gateway.

min.description: Minimum number of scale units deployed for ExpressRoute gateway.

name.description: Name of child port resource that is unique among child port resources of the parent.

properties.description: ExpressRouteLink properties.

cknSecretIdentifier.description: Keyvault Secret Identifier URL containing Mac security CKN key.

adminState.description: Administrative state of the physical port.

bandwidthInGbps.description: Bandwidth of procured ports in Gbps.

links.description: The set of physical links of the ExpressRoutePort resource.

peeringLocation.description: The name of the peering location that the ExpressRoutePort is mapped to physically.

name.description: The name of the extended location.

type.description: The type of the extended location.

keyVaultSecretId.description: Secret Id of (base-64 encoded unencrypted pfx) 'Secret' or 'Certificate' object stored in KeyVault.

action.description: The action type of a Filter rule collection.

ruleCollectionType.description: The type of the rule collection.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within the set of inbound NAT pools used by the load balancer. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of load balancer inbound nat pool.

backendPort.description: The port used for internal connections on the endpoint. Acceptable values are between 1 and 65535.

enableFloatingIP.description: Configures a virtual machine's endpoint for the floating IP capability required to configure a SQL AlwaysOn Availability Group. This setting is required when using the SQL AlwaysOn Availability Groups in SQL server. This setting can't be changed after you create the endpoint.

enableTcpReset.description: Receive bidirectional TCP Reset on TCP flow idle timeout or unexpected connection termination. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

frontendIPConfiguration.description: A reference to frontend IP addresses.

frontendPortRangeEnd.description: The last port number in the range of external ports that will be used to provide Inbound Nat to NICs associated with a load balancer. Acceptable values range between 1 and 65535.

frontendPortRangeStart.description: The first port number in the range of external ports that will be used to provide Inbound Nat to NICs associated with a load balancer. Acceptable values range between 1 and 65534.

idleTimeoutInMinutes.description: The timeout for the TCP idle connection. The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes. The default value is 4 minutes. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

protocol.description: The reference to the transport protocol used by the inbound NAT pool.

backendPort.description: The port used for the internal endpoint. Acceptable values range from 1 to 65535.

enableFloatingIP.description: Configures a virtual machine's endpoint for the floating IP capability required to configure a SQL AlwaysOn Availability Group. This setting is required when using the SQL AlwaysOn Availability Groups in SQL server. This setting can't be changed after you create the endpoint.

enableTcpReset.description: Receive bidirectional TCP Reset on TCP flow idle timeout or unexpected connection termination. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

frontendIPConfiguration.description: A reference to frontend IP addresses.

frontendPort.description: The port for the external endpoint. Port numbers for each rule must be unique within the Load Balancer. Acceptable values range from 1 to 65534.

idleTimeoutInMinutes.description: The timeout for the TCP idle connection. The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes. The default value is 4 minutes. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

protocol.description: The reference to the transport protocol used by the load balancing rule.

destinationPortRange.description: NVA port ranges to be opened up. One needs to provide specific ports.

protocol.description: Protocol. This should be either TCP or UDP.

sourceAddressPrefix.description: The CIDR or source IP range. Only /30, /31 and /32 Ip ranges are allowed.

prefix.description: The address prefix for the IpAllocation.

prefixLength.description: The address prefix length for the IpAllocation.

prefixType.description: The address prefix Type for the IpAllocation.

customBgpIpAddresses.description: The list of custom BGP peering addresses which belong to IP configuration.

ipconfigurationId.description: The ID of IP configuration which belongs to gateway.

name.description: The name of the resource. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the IP configuration profile.

subnet.description: The reference to the subnet resource to create a container network interface ip configuration.

dhGroup.description: The DH Group used in IKE Phase 1 for initial SA.

pfsGroup.description: The Pfs Group used in IKE Phase 2 for new child SA.

saDataSizeKilobytes.description: The IPSec Security Association (also called Quick Mode or Phase 2 SA) payload size in KB for a site to site VPN tunnel.

saLifeTimeSeconds.description: The IPSec Security Association (also called Quick Mode or Phase 2 SA) lifetime in seconds for a site to site VPN tunnel.

ipTagType.description: The IP tag type. Example: FirstPartyUsage.

tag.description: The value of the IP tag associated with the public IP. Example: SQL.

addressPrefix.description: /125 IP address space to carve out customer addresses for global reach.

routeFilter.description: The reference to the RouteFilter resource.

properties.description: Properties of load balancer backend address pool.

ipAddress.description: IP Address belonging to the referenced virtual network.

loadBalancerFrontendIPConfiguration.description: Reference to the frontend ip address configuration defined in regional loadbalancer.

virtualNetwork.description: Reference to an existing virtual network.

backendAddressPools.description: Collection of backend address pools used by a load balancer.

frontendIPConfigurations.description: Object representing the frontend IPs to be used for the load balancer.

inboundNatPools.description: Defines an external port range for inbound NAT to a single backend port on NICs associated with a load balancer. Inbound NAT rules are created automatically for each NIC associated with the Load Balancer using an external port from this range. Defining an Inbound NAT pool on your Load Balancer is mutually exclusive with defining inbound Nat rules. Inbound NAT pools are referenced from virtual machine scale sets. NICs that are associated with individual virtual machines cannot reference an inbound NAT pool. They have to reference individual inbound NAT rules.

inboundNatRules.description: Collection of inbound NAT Rules used by a load balancer. Defining inbound NAT rules on your load balancer is mutually exclusive with defining an inbound NAT pool. Inbound NAT pools are referenced from virtual machine scale sets. NICs that are associated with individual virtual machines cannot reference an Inbound NAT pool. They have to reference individual inbound NAT rules.

loadBalancingRules.description: Object collection representing the load balancing rules Gets the provisioning.

probes.description: Collection of probe objects used in the load balancer.

name.description: Name of a load balancer SKU.

tier.description: Tier of a load balancer SKU.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within the set of load balancing rules used by the load balancer. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of load balancer load balancing rule.

backendAddressPool.description: A reference to a pool of DIPs. Inbound traffic is randomly load balanced across IPs in the backend IPs.

backendPort.description: The port used for internal connections on the endpoint. Acceptable values are between 0 and 65535. Note that value 0 enables "Any Port".

disableOutboundSnat.description: Configures SNAT for the VMs in the backend pool to use the publicIP address specified in the frontend of the load balancing rule.

enableFloatingIP.description: Configures a virtual machine's endpoint for the floating IP capability required to configure a SQL AlwaysOn Availability Group. This setting is required when using the SQL AlwaysOn Availability Groups in SQL server. This setting can't be changed after you create the endpoint.

enableTcpReset.description: Receive bidirectional TCP Reset on TCP flow idle timeout or unexpected connection termination. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

frontendIPConfiguration.description: A reference to frontend IP addresses.

frontendPort.description: The port for the external endpoint. Port numbers for each rule must be unique within the Load Balancer. Acceptable values are between 0 and 65534. Note that value 0 enables "Any Port".

idleTimeoutInMinutes.description: The timeout for the TCP idle connection. The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes. The default value is 4 minutes. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

loadDistribution.description: The load distribution policy for this rule.

probe.description: The reference to the load balancer probe used by the load balancing rule.

protocol.description: The reference to the transport protocol used by the load balancing rule.

properties.description: Properties of the local network gateway.

bgpSettings.description: Local network gateway's BGP speaker settings.

gatewayIpAddress.description: IP address of local network gateway.

ruleGroupName.description: The managed rule group to override.

rules.description: List of rules that will be disabled. If none specified, all rules in the group will be disabled.

state.description: The state of the managed rule. Defaults to Disabled if not specified.

exclusions.description: The Exclusions that are applied on the policy.

managedRuleSets.description: The managed rule sets that are associated with the policy.

ruleGroupOverrides.description: Defines the rule group overrides to apply to the rule set.

ruleSetType.description: Defines the rule set type to use.

ruleSetVersion.description: Defines the version of the rule set to use.

type.description: The type of identity used for the resource. The type 'SystemAssigned, UserAssigned' includes both an implicitly created identity and a set of user assigned identities. The type 'None' will remove any identities from the virtual machine.

userAssignedIdentities.description: The list of user identities associated with resource. The user identity dictionary key references will be ARM resource ids in the form: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}'.

negationConditon.description: Whether this is negate condition or not.

properties.description: Nat Gateway properties.

zones.description: A list of availability zones denoting the zone in which Nat Gateway should be deployed.

idleTimeoutInMinutes.description: The idle timeout of the nat gateway.

publicIpAddresses.description: An array of public ip addresses associated with the nat gateway resource.

publicIpPrefixes.description: An array of public ip prefixes associated with the nat gateway resource.

destinationAddresses.description: List of destination IP addresses or Service Tags.

sourceAddresses.description: List of source IP addresses for this rule.

sourceIpGroups.description: List of source IpGroups for this rule.

translatedAddress.description: The translated address for this NAT rule.

translatedFqdn.description: The translated FQDN for this NAT rule.

translatedPort.description: The translated port for this NAT rule.

dnsServers.description: List of DNS servers IP addresses. Use 'AzureProvidedDNS' to switch to azure provided DNS resolution. 'AzureProvidedDNS' value cannot be combined with other IPs, it must be the only value in dnsServers collection.

internalDnsNameLabel.description: Relative DNS name for this NIC used for internal communications between VMs in the same virtual network.

properties.description: Network interface IP configuration properties.

applicationSecurityGroups.description: Application security groups in which the IP configuration is included.

primary.description: Whether this is a primary customer address on the network interface.

privateIPAddress.description: Private IP address of the IP configuration.

enableAcceleratedNetworking.description: If the network interface is accelerated networking enabled.

enableIPForwarding.description: Indicates whether IP forwarding is enabled on this network interface.

containerNetworkInterfaceConfigurations.description: List of chid container network interface configurations.

destinationAddresses.description: List of destination IP addresses or Service Tags.

destinationIpGroups.description: List of destination IpGroups for this rule.

sourceAddresses.description: List of source IP addresses for this rule.

sourceIpGroups.description: List of source IpGroups for this rule.

securityRules.description: A collection of security rules of the network security group.

virtualHub.description: The Virtual Hub where Network Virtual Appliance is being deployed.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within the set of outbound rules used by the load balancer. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of load balancer outbound rule.

allocatedOutboundPorts.description: The number of outbound ports to be used for NAT.

backendAddressPool.description: A reference to a pool of DIPs. Outbound traffic is randomly load balanced across IPs in the backend IPs.

enableTcpReset.description: Receive bidirectional TCP Reset on TCP flow idle timeout or unexpected connection termination. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

frontendIPConfigurations.description: The Frontend IP addresses of the load balancer.

idleTimeoutInMinutes.description: The timeout for the TCP idle connection.

protocol.description: The protocol for the outbound rule in load balancer.

selector.description: When matchVariable is a collection, operator used to specify which elements in the collection this exclusion applies to.

selectorMatchOperator.description: When matchVariable is a collection, operate on the selector to specify which elements in the collection this exclusion applies to.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the P2S connection configuration.

enableInternetSecurity.description: Flag indicating whether the enable internet security flag is turned on for the P2S Connections or not.

routingConfiguration.description: The Routing Configuration indicating the associated and propagated route tables on this connection.

vpnClientAddressPool.description: The reference to the address space resource which represents Address space for P2S VpnClient.

customDnsServers.description: List of all customer specified DNS servers IP addresses.

isRoutingPreferenceInternet.description: Enable Routing Preference property for the Public IP Interface of the P2SVpnGateway.

p2SConnectionConfigurations.description: List of all p2s connection configurations of the gateway.

virtualHub.description: The VirtualHub to which the gateway belongs.

vpnGatewayScaleUnit.description: The scale unit for this p2s vpn gateway.

vpnServerConfiguration.description: The VpnServerConfiguration to which the p2sVpnGateway is attached to.

localIPAddress.description: Local IP Address to be filtered on. Notation: "127.0.0.1" for single address entry. "127.0.0.1-127.0.0.255" for range. "127.0.0.1;127.0.0.5"? for multiple entries. Multiple ranges not currently supported. Mixing ranges with multiple entries not currently supported. Default = null.

localPort.description: Local port to be filtered on. Notation: "80" for single port entry."80-85" for range. "80;443;" for multiple entries. Multiple ranges not currently supported. Mixing ranges with multiple entries not currently supported. Default = null.

remoteIPAddress.description: Local IP Address to be filtered on. Notation: "127.0.0.1" for single address entry. "127.0.0.1-127.0.0.255" for range. "127.0.0.1;127.0.0.5;" for multiple entries. Multiple ranges not currently supported. Mixing ranges with multiple entries not currently supported. Default = null.

remotePort.description: Remote port to be filtered on. Notation: "80" for single port entry."80-85" for range. "80;443;" for multiple entries. Multiple ranges not currently supported. Mixing ranges with multiple entries not currently supported. Default = null.

bytesToCapturePerPacket.description: Number of bytes captured per packet, the remaining bytes are truncated.

filters.description: A list of packet capture filters.

storageLocation.description: The storage location for a packet capture session.

target.description: The ID of the targeted resource, only VM is currently supported.

timeLimitInSeconds.description: Maximum duration of the capture session in seconds.

totalBytesPerSession.description: Maximum size of the capture output.

filePath.description: A valid local path on the targeting VM. Must include the name of the capture file (*.cap). For linux virtual machine it must start with /var/captures. Required if no storage ID is provided, otherwise optional.

storageId.description: The ID of the storage account to save the packet capture session. Required if no local file path is provided.

storagePath.description: The URI of the storage path to save the packet capture. Must be a well-formed URI describing the location to save the packet capture.

fileUploadLimitInMb.description: Maximum file upload size in Mb for WAF.

maxRequestBodySizeInKb.description: Maximum request body size in Kb for WAF.

requestBodyCheck.description: Whether to allow WAF to check request Body.

name.description: Name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the private dns zone configuration.

privateDnsZoneConfigs.description: A collection of private dns zone configurations of the private dns zone group.

privateDnsZoneId.description: The resource id of the private dns zone.

privateLinkServiceConnectionState.description: A collection of information about the state of the connection between service consumer and provider.

customDnsConfigs.description: An array of custom dns configurations.

manualPrivateLinkServiceConnections.description: A grouping of information about the connection to the remote resource. Used when the network admin does not have access to approve connections to the remote resource.

privateLinkServiceConnections.description: A grouping of information about the connection to the remote resource.

subnet.description: The ID of the subnet from which the private IP will be allocated.

properties.description: Properties of the private link service.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the private link service connection.

groupIds.description: The ID(s) of the group(s) obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.

privateLinkServiceConnectionState.description: A collection of read-only information about the state of the connection to the remote resource.

privateLinkServiceId.description: The resource id of private link service.

requestMessage.description: A message passed to the owner of the remote resource with this connection request. Restricted to 140 chars.

actionsRequired.description: A message indicating if changes on the service provider require any updates on the consumer.

description.description: The reason for approval/rejection of the connection.

status.description: Indicates whether the connection has been Approved/Rejected/Removed by the owner of the service.

name.description: The name of private link service ip configuration.

properties.description: Properties of the private link service ip configuration.

primary.description: Whether the ip configuration is primary or not.

privateIPAddress.description: The private IP address of the IP configuration.

privateIPAddressVersion.description: Whether the specific IP configuration is IPv4 or IPv6. Default is IPv4.

privateIPAllocationMethod.description: The private IP address allocation method.

subnet.description: The reference to the subnet resource.

autoApproval.description: The auto-approval list of the private link service.

enableProxyProtocol.description: Whether the private link service is enabled for proxy protocol or not.

ipConfigurations.description: An array of private link service IP configurations.

loadBalancerFrontendIpConfigurations.description: An array of references to the load balancer IP configurations.

visibility.description: The visibility list of the private link service.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within the set of probes used by the load balancer. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of load balancer probe.

intervalInSeconds.description: The interval, in seconds, for how frequently to probe the endpoint for health status. Typically, the interval is slightly less than half the allocated timeout period (in seconds) which allows two full probes before taking the instance out of rotation. The default value is 15, the minimum value is 5.

numberOfProbes.description: The number of probes where if no response, will result in stopping further traffic from being delivered to the endpoint. This values allows endpoints to be taken out of rotation faster or slower than the typical times used in Azure.

port.description: The port for communicating the probe. Possible values range from 1 to 65535, inclusive.

protocol.description: The protocol of the end point. If 'Tcp' is specified, a received ACK is required for the probe to be successful. If 'Http' or 'Https' is specified, a 200 OK response from the specifies URI is required for the probe to be successful.

requestPath.description: The URI used for requesting health status from the VM. Path is required if a protocol is set to http. Otherwise, it is not allowed. There is no default value.

ids.description: The list of resource ids of all the RouteTables.

protocol.description: The protocol for which the DDoS protection policy is being customized.

sourceRateOverride.description: The customized DDoS protection source rate.

triggerRateOverride.description: The customized DDoS protection trigger rate.

triggerSensitivityOverride.description: The customized DDoS protection trigger rate sensitivity degrees. High: Trigger rate set with most sensitivity w.r.t. normal traffic. Default: Trigger rate set with moderate sensitivity w.r.t. normal traffic. Low: Trigger rate set with less sensitivity w.r.t. normal traffic. Relaxed: Trigger rate set with least sensitivity w.r.t. normal traffic.

domainNameLabel.description: The domain name label. The concatenation of the domain name label and the regionalized DNS zone make up the fully qualified domain name associated with the public IP address. If a domain name label is specified, an A DNS record is created for the public IP in the Microsoft Azure DNS system.

fqdn.description: The Fully Qualified Domain Name of the A DNS record associated with the public IP. This is the concatenation of the domainNameLabel and the regionalized DNS zone.

reverseFqdn.description: The reverse FQDN. A user-visible, fully qualified domain name that resolves to this public IP address. If the reverseFqdn is specified, then a PTR DNS record is created pointing from the IP address in the in-addr.arpa domain to the reverse FQDN.

ddosSettings.description: The DDoS protection custom policy associated with the public IP address.

dnsSettings.description: The FQDN of the DNS record associated with the public IP address.

idleTimeoutInMinutes.description: The idle timeout of the public IP address.

ipAddress.description: The IP address associated with the public IP address resource.

ipTags.description: The list of tags associated with the public IP address.

linkedPublicIPAddress.description: The linked public IP address of the public IP address resource.

migrationPhase.description: Migration phase of Public IP Address.

natGateway.description: The NatGateway for the Public IP address.

publicIPAllocationMethod.description: The public IP address allocation method.

publicIPPrefix.description: The Public IP Prefix this Public IP Address should be allocated from.

name.description: Name of a public IP address SKU.

tier.description: Tier of a public IP address SKU.

customIPPrefix.description: The customIpPrefix that this prefix is associated with.

ipTags.description: The list of tags associated with the public IP prefix.

prefixLength.description: The Length of the Public IP Prefix.

name.description: Name of a public IP prefix SKU.

tier.description: Tier of a public IP prefix SKU.

radiusServerAddress.description: The address of this radius server.

radiusServerScore.description: The initial score assigned to this radius server.

radiusServerSecret.description: The secret used for this radius server.

days.description: Number of days to retain flow log records.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the route.

rules.description: Collection of RouteFilterRules contained within a route filter.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the route filter rule.

access.description: The access type of the rule.

communities.description: The collection for bgp community values to filter on. e.g. ['12076:5010','12076:5020'].

routeFilterRuleType.description: The rule type of the rule.

addressPrefix.description: The destination CIDR to which the route applies.

nextHopIpAddress.description: The IP address packets should be forwarded to. Next hop values are only allowed in routes where the next hop type is VirtualAppliance.

nextHopType.description: The type of Azure hop the packet should be sent to.

disableBgpRoutePropagation.description: Whether to disable the routes learned by BGP on that route table. True means disable.

routes.description: Collection of routes contained within a route table.

associatedRouteTable.description: The resource id RouteTable associated with this RoutingConfiguration.

propagatedRouteTables.description: The list of RouteTables to advertise the routes to.

vnetRoutes.description: List of routes that control routing from VirtualHub into a virtual network connection.

virtualHub.description: The virtualHub to which the Security Partner Provider belongs.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the security rule.

access.description: The network traffic is allowed or denied.

description.description: A description for this rule. Restricted to 140 chars.

destinationAddressPrefix.description: The destination address prefix. CIDR or destination IP range. Asterisk '*' can also be used to match all source IPs. Default tags such as 'VirtualNetwork', 'AzureLoadBalancer' and 'Internet' can also be used.

destinationAddressPrefixes.description: The destination address prefixes. CIDR or destination IP ranges.

destinationApplicationSecurityGroups.description: The application security group specified as destination.

destinationPortRange.description: The destination port or range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535. Asterisk '*' can also be used to match all ports.

direction.description: The direction of the rule. The direction specifies if rule will be evaluated on incoming or outgoing traffic.

priority.description: The priority of the rule. The value can be between 100 and 4096. The priority number must be unique for each rule in the collection. The lower the priority number, the higher the priority of the rule.

protocol.description: Network protocol this rule applies to.

sourceAddressPrefix.description: The CIDR or source IP range. Asterisk '*' can also be used to match all source IPs. Default tags such as 'VirtualNetwork', 'AzureLoadBalancer' and 'Internet' can also be used. If this is an ingress rule, specifies where network traffic originates from.

sourceAddressPrefixes.description: The CIDR or source IP ranges.

sourceApplicationSecurityGroups.description: The application security group specified as source.

sourcePortRange.description: The source port or range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535. Asterisk '*' can also be used to match all ports.

serviceName.description: The name of the service to whom the subnet should be delegated (e.g. Microsoft.Sql/servers).

properties.description: Properties of the service end point policy.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the service endpoint policy definition.

description.description: A description for this rule. Restricted to 140 chars.

serviceEndpointPolicyDefinitions.description: A collection of service endpoint policy definitions of the service endpoint policy.

service.description: The type of the endpoint service.

name.description: The name of the StaticRoute that is unique within a VnetRoute.

nextHopIpAddress.description: The ip address of the next hop.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the subnet.

addressPrefix.description: The address prefix for the subnet.

addressPrefixes.description: List of address prefixes for the subnet.

delegations.description: An array of references to the delegations on the subnet.

ipAllocations.description: Array of IpAllocation which reference this subnet.

natGateway.description: Nat gateway associated with this subnet.

networkSecurityGroup.description: The reference to the NetworkSecurityGroup resource.

privateEndpointNetworkPolicies.description: Enable or Disable apply network policies on private end point in the subnet.

privateLinkServiceNetworkPolicies.description: Enable or Disable apply network policies on private link service in the subnet.

routeTable.description: The reference to the RouteTable resource.

serviceEndpointPolicies.description: An array of service endpoint policies.

trafficAnalyticsInterval.description: The interval in minutes which would decide how frequently TA service should do flow analytics.

workspaceId.description: The resource guid of the attached workspace.

workspaceRegion.description: The location of the attached workspace.

workspaceResourceId.description: Resource Id of the attached workspace.

networkWatcherFlowAnalyticsConfiguration.description: Parameters that define the configuration of traffic analytics.

localAddressRanges.description: A collection of local address spaces in CIDR format.

remoteAddressRanges.description: A collection of remote address spaces in CIDR format.

id.description: The resource URI for the Virtual Hub where the ExpressRoute gateway is or will be deployed. The Virtual Hub resource and the ExpressRoute gateway resource reside in the same subscription.

allowBranchToBranchTraffic.description: Flag to control transit for VirtualRouter hub.

azureFirewall.description: The azureFirewall associated with this VirtualHub.

expressRouteGateway.description: The expressRouteGateway associated with this VirtualHub.

p2SVpnGateway.description: The P2SVpnGateway associated with this VirtualHub.

routeTable.description: The routeTable associated with this virtual hub.

securityPartnerProvider.description: The securityPartnerProvider associated with this VirtualHub.

virtualHubRouteTableV2s.description: List of all virtual hub route table v2s associated with this VirtualHub.

virtualWan.description: The VirtualWAN to which the VirtualHub belongs.

vpnGateway.description: The VpnGateway associated with this VirtualHub.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the virtual hub route table v2.

attachedConnections.description: List of all connections attached to this route table v2.

virtualNetworkCommunity.description: The BGP community associated with the virtual network.

extendedLocation.description: The extended location of type local virtual network gateway.

properties.description: Properties of the virtual network gateway.

connectionMode.description: The connection mode for this connection.

connectionProtocol.description: Connection protocol used for this connection.

dpdTimeoutSeconds.description: The dead peer detection timeout of this connection in seconds.

expressRouteGatewayBypass.description: Bypass ExpressRoute Gateway for data forwarding.

ipsecPolicies.description: The IPSec Policies to be considered by this connection.

localNetworkGateway2.description: The reference to local network gateway resource.

trafficSelectorPolicies.description: The Traffic Selector Policies to be considered by this connection.

useLocalAzureIpAddress.description: Use private local Azure IP for the connection.

virtualNetworkGateway1.description: The reference to virtual network gateway resource.

virtualNetworkGateway2.description: The reference to virtual network gateway resource.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the virtual network gateway ip configuration.

privateIPAllocationMethod.description: The private IP address allocation method.

publicIPAddress.description: The reference to the public IP resource.

subnet.description: The reference to the subnet resource.

bgpSettings.description: Virtual network gateway's BGP speaker settings.

customRoutes.description: The reference to the address space resource which represents the custom routes address space specified by the customer for virtual network gateway and VpnClient.

enableBgp.description: Whether BGP is enabled for this virtual network gateway or not.

enableDnsForwarding.description: Whether dns forwarding is enabled or not.

enablePrivateIpAddress.description: Whether private IP needs to be enabled on this gateway for connections or not.

gatewayDefaultSite.description: The reference to the LocalNetworkGateway resource which represents local network site having default routes. Assign Null value in case of removing existing default site setting.

gatewayType.description: The type of this virtual network gateway.

ipConfigurations.description: IP configurations for virtual network gateway.

sku.description: The reference to the VirtualNetworkGatewaySku resource which represents the SKU selected for Virtual network gateway.

vNetExtendedLocationResourceId.description: Customer vnet resource id. VirtualNetworkGateway of type local gateway is associated with the customer vnet.

vpnClientConfiguration.description: The reference to the VpnClientConfiguration resource which represents the P2S VpnClient configurations.

vpnGatewayGeneration.description: The generation for this VirtualNetworkGateway. Must be None if gatewayType is not VPN.

vpnType.description: The type of this virtual network gateway.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the virtual network peering.

allowForwardedTraffic.description: Whether the forwarded traffic from the VMs in the local virtual network will be allowed/disallowed in remote virtual network.

allowGatewayTransit.description: If gateway links can be used in remote virtual networking to link to this virtual network.

allowVirtualNetworkAccess.description: Whether the VMs in the local virtual network space would be able to access the VMs in remote virtual network space.

peeringState.description: The status of the virtual network peering.

remoteAddressSpace.description: The reference to the remote virtual network address space.

remoteBgpCommunities.description: The reference to the remote virtual network's Bgp Communities.

remoteVirtualNetwork.description: The reference to the remote virtual network. The remote virtual network can be in the same or different region (preview). See here to register for the preview and learn more (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-network/virtual-network-create-peering).

useRemoteGateways.description: If remote gateways can be used on this virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and allowGatewayTransit on remote peering is also true, virtual network will use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network already has a gateway.

addressSpace.description: The AddressSpace that contains an array of IP address ranges that can be used by subnets.

bgpCommunities.description: Bgp Communities sent over ExpressRoute with each route corresponding to a prefix in this VNET.

ddosProtectionPlan.description: The DDoS protection plan associated with the virtual network.

dhcpOptions.description: The dhcpOptions that contains an array of DNS servers available to VMs deployed in the virtual network.

enableDdosProtection.description: Indicates if DDoS protection is enabled for all the protected resources in the virtual network. It requires a DDoS protection plan associated with the resource.

enableVmProtection.description: Indicates if VM protection is enabled for all the subnets in the virtual network.

ipAllocations.description: Array of IpAllocation which reference this VNET.

subnets.description: A list of subnets in a Virtual Network.

virtualNetworkPeerings.description: A list of peerings in a Virtual Network.

destinationLoadBalancerFrontEndIPConfigu.description: The reference to the private IP address on the internal Load Balancer that will receive the tap.

destinationNetworkInterfaceIPConfigurati.description: The reference to the private IP Address of the collector nic that will receive the tap.

destinationPort.description: The VXLAN destination port that will receive the tapped traffic.

hostedGateway.description: The Gateway on which VirtualRouter is hosted.

hostedSubnet.description: The Subnet on which VirtualRouter is hosted.

allowBranchToBranchTraffic.description: True if branch to branch traffic is allowed.

allowVnetToVnetTraffic.description: True if Vnet to Vnet traffic is allowed.

disableVpnEncryption.description: Vpn encryption to be disabled or not.

aadAudience.description: The AADAudience property of the VirtualNetworkGateway resource for vpn client connection used for AAD authentication.

aadIssuer.description: The AADIssuer property of the VirtualNetworkGateway resource for vpn client connection used for AAD authentication.

aadTenant.description: The AADTenant property of the VirtualNetworkGateway resource for vpn client connection used for AAD authentication.

radiusServerAddress.description: The radius server address property of the VirtualNetworkGateway resource for vpn client connection.

radiusServers.description: The radiusServers property for multiple radius server configuration.

radiusServerSecret.description: The radius secret property of the VirtualNetworkGateway resource for vpn client connection.

vpnClientAddressPool.description: The reference to the address space resource which represents Address space for P2S VpnClient.

vpnClientIpsecPolicies.description: VpnClientIpsecPolicies for virtual network gateway P2S client.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the vpn client revoked certificate.

thumbprint.description: The revoked VPN client certificate thumbprint.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the vpn client root certificate.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the VPN connection.

dpdTimeoutSeconds.description: DPD timeout in seconds for vpn connection.

ipsecPolicies.description: The IPSec Policies to be considered by this connection.

remoteVpnSite.description: Id of the connected vpn site.

routingConfiguration.description: The Routing Configuration indicating the associated and propagated route tables on this connection.

useLocalAzureIpAddress.description: Use local azure ip to initiate connection.

vpnConnectionProtocolType.description: Connection protocol used for this connection.

vpnLinkConnections.description: List of all vpn site link connections to the gateway.

bgpSettings.description: Local network gateway's BGP speaker settings.

connections.description: List of all vpn connections to the gateway.

isRoutingPreferenceInternet.description: Enable Routing Preference property for the Public IP Interface of the VpnGateway.

virtualHub.description: The VirtualHub to which the gateway belongs.

vpnGatewayScaleUnit.description: The scale unit for this vpn gateway.

bgpPeeringAddress.description: The BGP peering address and BGP identifier of this BGP speaker.

thumbprint.description: The Radius client root certificate thumbprint.

aadAuthenticationParameters.description: The set of aad vpn authentication parameters.

name.description: The name of the VpnServerConfiguration that is unique within a resource group.

radiusClientRootCertificates.description: Radius client root certificate of VpnServerConfiguration.

radiusServerAddress.description: The radius server address property of the VpnServerConfiguration resource for point to site client connection.

radiusServerRootCertificates.description: Radius Server root certificate of VpnServerConfiguration.

radiusServers.description: Multiple Radius Server configuration for VpnServerConfiguration.

radiusServerSecret.description: The radius secret property of the VpnServerConfiguration resource for point to site client connection.

vpnAuthenticationTypes.description: VPN authentication types for the VpnServerConfiguration.

vpnClientRevokedCertificates.description: VPN client revoked certificate of VpnServerConfiguration.

vpnClientRootCertificates.description: VPN client root certificate of VpnServerConfiguration.

thumbprint.description: The revoked VPN client certificate thumbprint.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.

properties.description: Properties of the VPN site link.

properties.description: Properties of the VPN site link connection.

ipsecPolicies.description: The IPSec Policies to be considered by this connection.

useLocalAzureIpAddress.description: Use local azure ip to initiate connection.

vpnConnectionProtocolType.description: Connection protocol used for this connection.

vpnSiteLink.description: Id of the connected vpn site link.

addressSpace.description: The AddressSpace that contains an array of IP address ranges.

siteKey.description: The key for vpn-site that can be used for connections.

virtualWan.description: The VirtualWAN to which the vpnSite belongs.

vpnSiteLinks.description: List of all vpn site links.

name.description: The name of the resource that is unique within a policy. This name can be used to access the resource.

priority.description: Priority of the rule. Rules with a lower value will be evaluated before rules with a higher value.

customRules.description: The custom rules inside the policy.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway private endpoint connection.
